Class Process

java.lang.Object
Process
public class Process extends Object
Represents a single process in the system. This class stores both the input attributes (read from the file) and the performance metrics (calculated during the simulation).
Version:
1.0
Author:
Santiago Duque

  • Constructor Details

    • Process

      public Process(String label, int burstTime, int arrivalTime, int queueId, int priority)
      Constructor to create a new Process.
      Parameters:
      label - The unique identifier for the process.
      burstTime - The total required CPU time.
      arrivalTime - The arrival time into the system.
      queueId - The MLQ queue it is assigned to (1, 2, or 3).
      priority - The internal priority within its queue (5 is highest).

  • Method Details

    • runTick

      public void runTick()
      Simulates the execution of the process for one time unit (a "tick"). Decrements the remaining burst time.

    • itsOver

      public boolean itsOver()
      Checks if the process has completed all its execution.
      Returns:
      true if remainingBurstTime is 0, false otherwise.

    • calculateMetrics

      public void calculateMetrics(int currentCT)
      Calculates the final performance metrics (CT, TAT, WT) for this process. Response Time (RT) is calculated during the simulation.
      Parameters:
      currentCT - The value of the global clock (currentTime) when the process finished.

    • getPriority

      public int getPriority()
      Gets the internal priority of the process.
      Returns:
      The priority value (5 > 1).

    • getArrivalTime

      public int getArrivalTime()
      Gets the arrival time of the process.
      Returns:
      The arrival time (AT).
